page.title: 20LANGUAGE OF S.HARRIS
page.content:
{GAELIC}is spoken in most homes in S.HARRIS although there has been a decline in the number of fluent speakers in the past 10 to 20 years This may be due to the advent of television in the homes or due to a gradual increase in the number of non-Gaelic speakers moving into the area.
Here are a few sentences in {GAIDHLIG}(Gaelic) with a translation.
{Sinne clann Sgoil ant-Oib}. We are the children of Leverburgh School.
{Tha sinn toilichte a bhith a' deanamh {an obair tha seo We are pleased to be doing this work. {Beannachd leibh}. Goodbye.
